{{short description|American musician}} {{For|the country music artist|Ty Taylor (author)}} [[File:Ty Taylor 2014.jpg|thumb|upright=1.35|Taylor performing with [[Vintage Trouble]] in 2014]] '''Ty Taylor''' (born January 5, 1969, in [[Montclair, New Jersey]]) is an American musician best known for being the lead singer of [[Los Angeles]] [[soul music|soul rock]] band [[Vintage Trouble]]. He is the voice of character Lester Grimes on the [[HBO]] series ''[[Vinyl (TV series)|Vinyl]]'' created by [[Martin Scorsese]] and [[Mick Jagger]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.wmg.com/news/atlantic-and-warner-bros-records-create-groundbreaking-musical-experience-vinyl-new-hbo-drama|title=Warner Music Group Atlantic and Warner Bros. Records Create Groundbreaking Musical Experience for Vinyl, the New HBO® Drama Series from Martin Scorsese, Mick Jagger, and Terence Winter|website=Wmg.com|access-date=28 October 2021}} Taylor has two songs, "[[Cha Cha Twist]]" and "[[The World Is Yours (Ty Taylor song)|The World Is Yours]]," featured on the 2016 [[soundtrack]] album ''Vinyl: Music from the HBO Original Series, Volume 1''.{{Cite web|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/6843767/hbo-vinyl-soundtrack-exclusive|title=HBO's 'Vinyl' Series Soundtrack to Feature Otis Redding, Sturgill Simpson, David Johansen & Others: Exclusive|website=Billboard.com|access-date=28 October 2021}} He was formerly the guitarist and vocalist of [[R&B]] group [[Dakota Moon]] and was also a contestant on the [[reality TV show]] ''[[Rock Star: INXS]]''.{{Cite web |url=http://www.cbs.com/primetime/rock_star/performers/ty/ |title=CBS - Rock Star |website=[[CBS]] |access-date=2006-05-23 |archive-date=2012-02-08 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120208075353/http://www.cbs.com/primetime/rock_star/performers/ty/ |url-status=dead }} ==Music career== [[Gospel music]] was a significant influence on Taylor, having sung in a [[Baptist Church]] [[choir]] in his youth. Other musical influences include [[Otis Redding]], [[Tina Turner]] and [[The Clash]].{{Cite web|url=http://artistwiki.com/ty-taylor/biography|title=Ty Taylor biography|website=Artistwiki.com|access-date=28 October 2021}} After leaving ''Rockstar: INXS'', he was asked by [[Dave Navarro]] to sing guest lead vocals for his band [[Camp Freddy]]. In 2008, he formed the group [[Ghost Hounds]] and recorded a debut album, two songs from which were released as downloadable content for the video game ''[[Rock Band 2]]''. He has toured with many artists including [[Tina Turner]], [[Eric Clapton]], [[Macy Gray]], [[Fiona Apple]], and Robert Taylor. Taylor appeared on the cast recording of Jason Robert Brown's ''[[Songs for a New World]]'' recorded in 1996. Taylor also appeared as a guest singer on the bonus album given away with ''Shout,'' recorded by [[Govt Mule]], on the song "Bring on the Music." Other guests included [[Steve Winwood]], [[Elvis Costello]], and [[Dr. John]]. Most recently, Taylor has been the front man for the [[Los Angeles]] [[soul music|soul rock]] band [[Vintage Trouble]]. Notable performances include a supporting performance at the final concert of the annual free Summer Concert Series at The Americana at Brand where Vintage Trouble opened for [[Paula Cole]] and [[Tyler Hilton]],{{Cite web|url=https://www.broadwayworld.com/los-angeles/article/Grammy-winner-PAULA-COLE-Tyler-Hilton-and-Vintage-Trouble-close-Summer-Concert-Series-20010101|title=Grammy winner PAULA COLE, Tyler Hilton and Vintage Trouble close Summer Concert Series|website=BroadwayWorld.com|access-date=28 October 2021}} a headlining performance on the second stage of the California AIDS Walk (Taylor also performed [[Simon & Garfunkel]]'s "[[Bridge Over Troubled Water]]" on the main stage at the same benefit), and their weekly Tuesday night residency at Harvelle's Blues Club in [[Santa Monica, California]]. Vintage Trouble has supported rock acts like [[Lenny Kravitz]], [[Joss Stone]], [[Paloma Faith]], the [[Dixie Chicks]], [[The Who]], [[Bon Jovi]] and [[AC/DC]] on the 2015 [[Rock or Bust World Tour]]. ==Discography== 2019 Chapter II—EP II [[Vintage Trouble]] / Composer, Group Member, Lead Vocals

1990 The Legendary V-Disc Masters (1943-1944), Vol. 1 / Red Norvo & His Overseas Spotlight Band / Primary Artist{{Cite web|url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/ty-taylor-mn0000167401/credits|title=Ty Taylor | Credits|website=[[AllMusic]]|access-date=28 October 2021}} ==Musical theater== Taylor studied at [[Carnegie Mellon University]] in [[Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania|Pittsburgh]], where he graduated with a [[Bachelor of Fine Arts]] degree in [[drama]] and [[music]]. In addition to his work with Dakota Moon and ''Rock Star: INXS'', Taylor's music career has included parts in Broadway [[musicals]] ''[[Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat]]'', ''[[Pippin (musical)|Pippin]]'',{{cite web |url=http://www.dailynews.com/ci_11517702 |title='Pippin's' Ty Taylor has magic to do - LA Daily News |publisher=Dailynews.com |date=2009-01-21 |access-date=2012-11-06 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110628211540/http://www.dailynews.com/ci_11517702 |archive-date=2011-06-28 }} ''[[Songs for a New World]]'', ''[[Grease (musical)|Grease]]'', and ''[[We Will Rock You (musical)|We Will Rock You]]''. Taylor also played the role of "Freddie" in a Los Angeles performance of the musical ''[[Chess (musical)|Chess]]'', written by [[Tim Rice]], [[Benny Andersson]] and [[Björn Ulvaeus]].[http://weblogs.variety.com/thesetlist/2007/08/index.html] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080329035244/http://weblogs.variety.com/thesetlist/2007/08/index.html|date=March 29, 2008}} He also co-starred in the spoof ''[[Rogers the Musical]]'' with [[Adam Pascal]], featured in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] show ''[[Hawkeye (miniseries)|Hawkeye]]''. {{Cite web |last=Aslanian |first=Emily |title=How 'Rogers: The Musical' in 'Hawkeye' Came to Be |url=https://www.tvinsider.com/1024833/hawkeye-rogers-the-musical-marc-shaiman-scott-wittman-disney-plus/ |access-date=2022-09-18 |website=TV Insider |language=en-US}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{IMDb name|1400050}} * [http://www.vintagetrouble.com/ Official site of Vintage Trouble] * [http://www.theghosthoundsband.net Ty Taylor's Band Ghost Hound] * [http://www.rockstargohome.com/rock-star-inxs-ty-taylor.php Interview with Ty Taylor on Rockstargohome.com] * [http://www.wmg.com/news/atlantic-and-warner-bros-records-create-groundbreaking-musical-experience-vinyl-new-hbo-drama Warner Music Group Atlantic and Warner Bros. Records Create Groundbreaking Musical Experience for Vinyl, the New HBO® Drama Series from Martin Scorsese, Mick Jagger, and Terence Winter] {{Rock Star: INXS}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Taylor, Ty}} [[Category:1969 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Musicians from Montclair, New Jersey]] [[Category:Carnegie Mellon University College of Fine Arts alumni]] [[Category:Participants in American reality television series]] [[Category:Vintage Trouble members]]

{{Use mdy dates|date=November 2014}}
'''Ty Taylor''' is an American [[auctioneer]], author, [[cowboy]], and musician.

==Music career==

Ty Taylor is a [[country singer]], songwriter, and record producer<ref name="Taylor">{{cite book |first=Ty|last=Taylor|title=Take Me As I Am|year=1995|publisher=Powder River Productions}}</ref> who has performed on the ''[[Grand Ole Opry]]'' and ''[[Austin City Limits]]'' while working for [[Loretta Lynn]] and [[Doug Stone]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.workman.com/authors/ty_taylor/|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303232834/www.workman.com/authors/ty_taylor/|archive-date=2016-03-03|title=ABOUT TY TAYLOR}}</ref><ref name="Taylor and Hartnagle-Taylor">{{cite book|first1 = Jeanne Joy | last1 = Hartnagle-Taylor | first2 = Ty | last2 = Taylor |year = 2010|title=Stockdog Savvy|publisher=Alpine Publications|isbn=978-1-57779-106-5}}</ref>

Taylor started singing and playing guitar when he was ten years old, spurred on by his mother, a musician herself, who encouraged him to pursue music.<ref name=countrynights>{{citation|last=Madsen|first=Carol A.|title=Ty Taylor, A Man Who Sings From the Heart|date=November 1992|page=15|publisher=Country Nights Magazine}}</ref> In 1991, he made his debut as a [[country singer]] at the [[Texas State Fair]]. Prior to that time, Taylor toured nationally with various groups ranging from contemporary Christian rock, to country. From 1991 to 1995, he was based out of Colorado<ref name="Hartnagle-Taylor">{{cite book |first=Jeanne Joy |last= Hartnagle-Taylor|title=Greasepaint Matadors|year=1993|publisher=Alpine Publications|isbn=0-931866-56-1}}</ref> and toured the country with his Powder River Band.

Taylor gained national acclaim for his vocals when he performed with country artists such as [[Loretta Lynn]], [[Johnny Lee (singer)|Johnny Lee]], [[Vern Gosdin]], [[Tammy Wynette]], [[Crystal Gayle]], and [[Doug Stone]]. He has also opened for [[Chris LeDoux]], [[Mark Chesnutt]], [[Tanya Tucker]], [[Billy Ray Cyrus]], [[Daron Norwood]], [[Diamond Rio]], [[Clay Walker]], [[Tim McGraw]], and [[Charlie Daniels]]. He credits artists like [[George Jones]], [[Merle Haggard]], and [[Bob Wills]] as important musical influences.

==In the recording studio==

Ty is a traditionalist merging [[honky-tonk]] and [[western swing]] tunes with his own original material to develop the unique sound he is known for on his album ''Take Me As I Am''.<ref name="Taylor"/> He has also recorded demos, radio [[jingle]]s, and background vocals for other recording artists.<ref name=countrynights/> This talent led him to produce records for other artists.

==As A tribute artist==

Since 1995, Ty Taylor has performed as a [[George Strait]] [[tribute act]]<ref>{{citation|title=George Strait Tribute Adds Texas Swing|date=February 24, 2007|publisher=Cumberland Times-News|url=http://times-news.com/archive/x1540387270}}</ref> in [[Branson, Missouri]] at the Christy Lane Theater, on the [[Grand Ole Opry]] stage, [[Gaylord Opryland Resort & Convention Center]], and "Live at the Riverfront" during the [[CMA Music Festival]] in [[Nashville, Tennessee]].

==As A cowboy author==

Ty is also a real life [[cowboy]].  When he is not entertaining, he rides, ropes, and trains his [[Australian shepherd]]s and other [[cowdog]]s on his ranch.

In 2010, he collaborated on an educational and entertaining training book for [[herding dog]] enthusiasts, ''Stockdog Savvy'', with short stories about [[stock dog]]s and their owners.<ref name="Taylor and Hartnagle-Taylor"/><ref>[http://www.onlinedigitalpubs.com/display_article.php?id=528426 Western Horseman Magazine – October 2010]</ref>

==As A professional auctioneer==

Taylor received the [[title of honor|honorary title]] of [[colonel]] in 2006 when he graduated from the Missouri [[Auction School]].<ref>News Release, November 6, 2006, Missouri Auction School</ref>
